instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Prohibitory Sign
threads.message:
Hi all,

got a strange 12inch MacBook here.

Original issue was that it booted but to a flashing question mark. Narrowed this down to the Audio cable.

now it boots to the volume but slowly and then shows the prohibitory sign.

The IPD cable is also shorting <SIGNAL>US_G3H_TPAD_F</SIGNAL> to ground on F4800 and causes it not to boot at all.

so I have a new IPD cable on its way but my question is:

should the machine still boot to an OS even without the IPD trackpad and keyboard connected?

i know some of the MacBooks boot slow or donâ€™t boot without a battery etc. Wondered if this is the similar?

thanks
Jamie

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Prohibitory Sign
threads.message: Should boot yes. Try installing an OS on it and see what happens.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Prohibitory Sign
threads.message: Damn! I was able to boot to a known good OS and into the recovery partition but niether of them can actually see the internal drive. Yet it attempts to boot to it on a normal boot up... very strange
